author: @crowdnewswire
title: Glycerol Monostearate Market Projected Expansion to USD 14.42 billion by 2032, with a 5.44% CAGR
text:
Introduction Glycerol monostearate (GMS), commonly known as monostearin, is a versatile compound that has found its way into various industries due to its wide-ranging properties. It is an emulsifier, thickener, and preservative commonly used in food, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and other industries. With a growing demand for clean-label ingredients, functional additives, and effective formulations, the global glycerol monostearate market has seen significant growth. This article will explore the trends, growth drivers, challenges, and future prospects of the glycerol monostearate market.
What is Glycerol Monostearate? Glycerol monostearate is a glycerol ester of stearic acid and is primarily used as an emulsifying agent. It is a white, odorless, sweet-tasting, flaky powder that is soluble in organic solvents and insoluble in water. GMS is produced through the esterification of glycerol with stearic acid, which is derived from both vegetable and animal fats.
The food industry frequently uses GMS as an additive to improve texture, stabilize emulsions, and extend the shelf life of products. It is also popular in personal care products and pharmaceuticals, where it acts as a surfactant and stabilizer. The versatility of GMS in diverse applications makes it an essential component in many industries.
Get Full PDF Sample Copy of Report: https://www.marketresearchfuture.com/sample_request/22612
Market Overview The glycerol monostearate market is experiencing steady growth due to increased demand from the food, pharmaceutical, cosmetic, and personal care sectors. In 2023, the market size was estimated to be around USD 8.95 billion, and it is expected to continue growing at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of approximately 5.44% between 2024 and 2032.
The rising consumer demand for processed foods, functional ingredients, and personal care products with natural ingredients has propelled the need for glycerol monostearate. Additionally, technological advancements in product formulation, coupled with rising consumer health consciousness, are driving innovation in the market.
Market Drivers Several factors contribute to the growth of the glycerol monostearate market:
Increased Demand for Processed Foods : The growing global population, urbanization, and busy lifestyles have led to an increased demand for convenient and processed food products. Glycerol monostearate acts as an emulsifier in bakery products, ice cream, dairy products, and other food items, improving texture and shelf life.
Health and Wellness Trends : Consumers are becoming more health-conscious, demanding clean-label ingredients and healthier food options. GMS, derived from natural sources like vegetable oils, fits the bill as a functional additive. It enhances the quality of food without adding unhealthy fats or synthetic chemicals.
Growth in the Cosmetics and Personal Care Industry : The cosmetics and personal care industry is expanding rapidly, particularly in emerging markets. GMS is widely used in skincare, haircare, and cosmetic products as an emulsifier and thickening agent. Its ability to stabilize oil-water mixtures makes it a valuable ingredient in creams, lotions, and other topical formulations.
Pharmaceutical Applications : In the pharmaceutical industry, GMS is used as a stabilizer in various drug formulations. It helps in the controlled release of active ingredients and improves the bioavailability of certain drugs. The rise in chronic diseases and the aging population have increased the demand for pharmaceutical products, indirectly boosting the glycerol monostearate market.
Increasing Focus on Clean-Label Ingredients : Manufacturers are under pressure to use ingredients that are natural, recognizable, and perceived as healthy by consumers. GMS, being a naturally derived emulsifier, aligns well with the clean-label movement, making it a preferred choice for food and personal care products.
Technological Advancements in Product Formulation : Research and development activities have led to advancements in glycerol monostearate production, leading to more efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes. This has improved the availability of high-quality GMS for industrial use.
Buy Now this Report: https://www.marketresearchfuture.com/checkout?currency=one_user-USD&report_id=22612
Challenges Facing the Market While the glycerol monostearate market is poised for growth, it is not without challenges:
Fluctuations in Raw Material Prices : The primary raw materials for producing glycerol monostearate are glycerol and stearic acid, both of which are derived from vegetable and animal fats. Fluctuations in the prices of these raw materials, influenced by factors such as weather conditions, crop yields, and geopolitical tensions, can impact the production costs of GMS.
Stringent Regulatory Standards : The food, pharmaceutical, and cosmetic industries are subject to strict regulatory standards. Manufacturers must comply with these standards to ensure the safety and quality of their products. Any changes in regulations can result in additional costs and delays in product development.
Competition from Synthetic Alternatives : While glycerol monostearate is a popular natural emulsifier, there are synthetic alternatives available that may offer cost advantages or different functional properties. Manufacturers of GMS must continuously innovate and improve the quality of their products to stay competitive.
Environmental Concerns : The production of GMS involves the use of palm oil and other vegetable oils, raising concerns about deforestation, habitat destruction, and biodiversity loss. Companies are under pressure to adopt sustainable sourcing practices and minimize the environmental impact of their operations.
Regional Market Insights North America : The North American glycerol monostearate market is driven by high consumer demand for processed foods and personal care products. The presence of established food and cosmetic manufacturers in the region contributes to the steady growth of the market. Additionally, the clean-label trend and increased focus on sustainability have boosted the demand for naturally derived emulsifiers like GMS.
Europe : Europe is another major market for glycerol monostearate, with the food and cosmetics industries being the primary drivers. The region’s stringent regulatory standards and consumer preference for natural ingredients have contributed to the steady demand for GMS. European companies are also focusing on sustainability and responsible sourcing of raw materials.
Asia-Pacific : The Asia-Pacific region is expected to witness the highest growth rate in the glycerol monostearate market. The rapid expansion of the food, cosmetics, and pharmaceutical industries in countries like China, India, and Japan is driving demand. Rising disposable incomes and changing consumer preferences for processed and convenience foods are further fueling the market.
Latin America and Middle East & Africa : These regions are also witnessing increasing demand for glycerol monostearate, particularly in the food and personal care industries. As consumer awareness of health and wellness trends grows, the demand for natural and functional ingredients like GMS is expected to rise.
Key Companies in the Glycerol Monostearate Market Include:
Lonza Group AG, Stepan Company, Croda International Plc, Evonik Industries AG, Godrej Industries Limited, AkzoNobel NV, BASF SE, The DOW Chemical Company, Huntsman Corporation, Wilmar International Limited, Mitsubishi Chemical Corporation, ADM (Archer Daniels Midland) Company, P Chemicals, Kao Corporation, Cargill, Incorporated
Browse Full Report Details: https://www.marketresearchfuture.com/reports/glycerol-monostearate-market-22612
Future Outlook and Opportunities The glycerol monostearate market is expected to continue its growth trajectory, driven by the expanding food, cosmetics, and pharmaceutical industries. Emerging markets in Asia-Pacific, Latin America, and the Middle East & Africa present significant opportunities for growth due to increasing urbanization, rising disposable incomes, and evolving consumer preferences.
In addition, the trend toward clean-label ingredients, natural emulsifiers, and sustainable sourcing practices will continue to shape the market. Manufacturers that invest in research and development to improve the functional properties of GMS and adopt environmentally responsible practices will be well-positioned for long-term success.

author: DW
title: US university president resigns after antisemitism backlash — — News — Guardian TV
text: US university president resigns after antisemitism backlash By DW 24 December 2023 | 2:00 pm Following a congressional hearing over antisemitism on college campuses, University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magill was accused of giving evasive answers on whether calls for Jewish genocide breach conduct codes. In this article Related September 1, 2023 September 8, 2023 September 4, 2023 September 5, 2023 Related 31 Aug Military officers in oil-producing Gabon said they had seized power on Wednesday, placing President Ali Bongo under house arrest and naming a new leader after the Central African state's election body announced Bongo had won a third term. 1 Sep The vote for the largely ceremonial role is widely viewed as a test of support for the ruling People's Action Party. 8 Sep There are attempts to roll back LGBTQ rights in some European countries. Human rights experts tell DW it's not a backlash, but the result of a targeted campaign. 2 Sep The regional bloc CCAS, and the country's opposition coalition, have urged international partners to push for a rapid return to civilian rule. Also in this edition: In Democratic Republic of Congo, at least 48 protesters are reported to have been killed in the eastern city of Goma. And finally: In South Africa, the death toll rises to 76 after the devastating Johannesburg fire at an abandoned apartment block that housed dozens of homeless people and squatters. 4 Sep Pro-EU President Salome Zurabishvili is facing possible impeachment after she visited leaders in the bloc. The current government is seen by the opposition as taking the country away from Europe and toward Russia. 5 Sep President Bola Ahmed Tinubu arrives New Delhi ahead of the G-20 Summit in India. He is received by Senior Government officials of the India and Nigerian Governments. 10 Sep Federal prosecutors are looking to indict President Joe Biden's son, Hunter Biden, before the end of the month. The indictment could serve a blow to Biden's presidential campaign. 7 Sep We look at reactions from the local press after Mexico's governing and opposition parties nominate female candidates ahead of next year's presidential election. Also: Great Britain is not so great as the British weeklies deplore the "crumbling" state of the country. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi raises eyebrows with references to "Bharat", not India, in state-issued G20 invitations. Finally, find out what your favorite coffee beverage says about your personality! 14 Sep In the US, House Speaker Kevin McCarthy says the House of Representatives will open a formal impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden. That's a long-shot effort to remove the Democrat from office after two impeachments of former Republican president Donald Trump. The focus is on Biden's youngest son, Hunter, and allegations of corruption in business dealings as Catherine Viette explains. 23 Sep China has sharply rejected statements made by German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock in the United States about Chinese leader Xi Jinping. 20 Sep Keir Starmer is in Paris a day ahead of King Charle's delayed state visit to France. The UK opposition leader has said he wants closer ties to the EU but won't seek to rejoin the bloc. 22 Sep African Development Bank President, Akinwumi Adesina faults global finance architecture. Latest 22 mins ago The European Commission has approved a German government payment to energy providers that will see the early closure of coal-fired power plants. 22 mins ago A group of independent journalists have spent weeks investigating how Israel uses artificial intelligence to carry out air strikes in Gaza. Officially, the IDF has said little more than admitting it uses an AI system known as "Habsora", or "The Gospel" in English. The journalists' research raises the question of whether the high civilian casualty rate in Gaza is a result of Israel's extensive use of this AI system. 22 mins ago Japan has a groping problem. Almost every woman has encountered 'chikan', men who molest them in public places, often in crowded subway cars. Now one woman is fighting back - but she is an exception. 1 hour ago COP28 climate summit was in overtime as representatives from 200 countries debate a draft climate deal, including a reference to phasing out fossil fuels. 1 hour ago The Fortnite maker claimed the search engine giant abused its power to shield its app store from competition. Epic had lost a similar case against Apple, which is now under appeal. × Get the latest news delivered straight to your inbox every day of the week. Stay informed with the Guardian’s leading coverage of Nigerian and world news, business, technology and sports.

author: Pablo Lodeiro
title: La NBA desafía a Estados Unidos
text: En el Mundial del verano pasado de Indonesia y Filipinas, en el que Estados Unidos sumó un decepcionante cuarto puesto tras caer contra Alemania en las semifinales, su entrenador, el legendario Steve Kerr , cinco anillos de la NBA como jugador y tres como técnico, resumió a la perfección tras la derrota cuál es el panorama del baloncesto internacional en la actualidad. «El juego se ha globalizado en los últimos 30 años, ya no estamos en 1992. Los partidos se han vuelto muy difíciles. Los jugadores son mejores en todo el mundo, los equipos son mejores y no es fácil conseguir una victoria», resumía el estadounidense. Una realidad que tendrá su máxima expresión en los Juegos de París . En la capital gala se batirá el récord de jugadores que actualmente disputan la NBA, un total de 52 de los 144 (36.1%) que integran los 12 equipos que aspiran al oro. En Tokio 2020 fueron 48 y en Río 2016 , 46. Unas cifras que chocan con las de Barcelona 92, edición olímpica en la que Estados Unidos comenzó a convocar a las grandes estrellas de su liga y no a sus promesas universitarias. En la cita española, además de los 11 jugadores NBA de los Estados Unidos, solo había ocho baloncestistas más que brillaban al otro lado del Atlántico. La NBA ya no desafía al mundo. Es la NBA el mayor peligro al que se enfrenta Estados Unidos. Cierto es que la selección estadounidense ha creado un grupo espectacular para tal desafío, liderado por supercampeones como LeBron James (Los Angeles Lakers), Kevin Durant (Phoenix Suns) o Stephen Curry (Golden State Warriors); bien empaquetado por estrellas como Joel Embiid (Philadelphia 76ers), Jayson Tatum (Boston Celtics), Anthony Edwards (Minnesota Timberwolves), Devin Booker (Suns) o Tyrese Haliburton (Indiana Pacers); y cimentado con auténticos muros defensivos como Anthony Davis (Lakers), Bam Adebayo (Miami Heat), Jrue Holiday y Derrick White (ambos de los Celtics). Pero la competencia es más que real. Es Canadá el segundo conjunto que más NBA tiene después de sus vecinos, un total de 10. Bronce en el último Mundial , los norteamericanos están entrenados por el español Jordi Fernández y liderados en la pista por Shai Gilgeous-Alexander , que viene de promediar 30 puntos por noche con los Oklahoma City Thunder. Con Jamal Murray (Denver Nuggets) formará una pareja exterior que aspira a ser letal, mientras que Dillon Brooks (Houston Rockets) y Luguentz Dort (Thunder) pondrán la mala leche y el músculo. RJ Barrett (New York Knicks), Nickeil Alexander-Walker (Timberwolves), Trey Lyles (Sacramento Kings), Andrew Nembhard (Pacers), Kelly Olynyk (Toronto Raptors) y Dwight Powell (Dallas Mavericks) completan el grupo de élite de los canadienses. Noticia Relacionada Baloncesto estandar No Sergio Llull amplía contrato con el Real Madrid hasta 2025 Jorge Abizanda El balear, con 1.083 partidos, es ya el jugador que más encuentros ha disputado con la camiseta blancaEl podio lo cierra Australia , bronce en Tokio 2020. Los de las antípodas, uno de los equipos más competitivos de siempre en las citas internacionales, cuentan con ocho jugadores de la liga estadounidense. Son Patty Mills (Atlanta Hawks), Josh Giddey (Chicago Bulls), Joe Ingles (Orlando Magic), Dante Exum y Josh Green (Mavericks), Dyson Daniels (Atlanta Hawks), Jock Landale (Rockets) y Duop Reath (Portland Trail Blazers). Detrás de los australianos aparece Francia , plata hace tres años, anfitriona y con cinco atletas de categoría NBA. Victor Wembanyama , de 20 años, con 2,24 metros de altura, una envergadura de 244 centímetros y estrella de los San Antonio Spurs, es la gran baza para no decepcionar a sus aficionados, pese a que los galos han perdido los últimos cuatro partidos de preparación para los Juegos, ante Alemania, Serbia, Canadá y Australia. Rudy Gobert (Timberwolves), Evan Fournier (Detroit Pistons), Nicolas Batum (Los Angeles Clippers) y Bilal Coulibaly (Washington Wizards) también juegan en Estados Unidos. Alemania , actual campeona del mundo, tiene cuatro: Dennis Schröder (New Jersey Nets), Daniel Theis (New Orleans Pelicans) y los hermanos Wagner, Franz y Mo (los dos juegan en los Orlando Magic). Por su parte, Serbia posee los mismos que los germanos. Son Bogdan Bogdanovic (Hawks), Vasilije Micic (Charlotte Hornets), Nikola Jovic (Heat) y, por descontado, Nikola Jokic , campeón de la NBA con los Nuggets en 2023 y nombrado mejor jugador de la NBA en 2021, 2022 y 2024. En el grupo de cola, con solo un representante, están España, Grecia, Japón, Puerto Rico y Sudán del Sur. Nuestra selección solo cuenta con Santi Aldama (Memphis Grizzlies), pues Usman Garuba vio cómo los Warriors rescindían su contrato el mes pasado. Los helenos están liderados por Giannis Antetokounmpo , MVP de la NBA en 2019, 2020 y campeón de la misma en 2021 con los Milwaukee Bucks, mientras que los asiáticos cuentan con el talento de Rui Hachimura (Lakers). En el conjunto caribeño está José Alvarad o (Pelicans) y en el africano JT Thor (Hornets). El sábado, con el España-Australia, comenzará la lucha entre el \u0027Dream Team\u0027 y la NBA por el oro olímpico.

author: Ash Martinez
title: What happened to Japan after WW2?
text: Unlike Germany, [Japan](https://wegotthiscovered.com/tag/japan) has managed to elude much of the negative connotations attached to the Axis powers during [World War 2](https://wegotthiscovered.com/tag/World-war-2/). By the Cold War, Japan was America’s premier ally in the Asia Pacific region. By the early aughts, it was synonymous with anime, sushi, and its many cultural staples. The enemies-to-allies tale came on the heels of years of war, the bombing of Pearl Harbor, the horrific introduction of the atomic bombs over [Hiroshima and Nagasaki](https://wegotthiscovered.com/fyi/why-was-hiroshima-chosen-as-the-bombing-site/), and the deaths of more than 2.5 million Japanese citizens. History shows multiple instances where [American involvement bred hostility](https://wegotthiscovered.com/fyi/what-happened-to-vietnam-after-ww2/), but despite 8 years of occupation, Japan remains one of the U.S. most ardent allies. The end of WWII and the American occupation By the time Japan surrendered in August of 1945, the country was devastated. More than 2.5 million people perished during the war — 500,000 among them civilians. The Allied powers, mostly the U.S. Airforce, laid heavy aerial attacks on the major military hubs, firebombing metropolitan areas like Tokyo and Kyoto, leaving massive swaths of the cities little more than ashes. 1/3 of the nation’s wealth was gone, spent on the war effort, or burned away in the siege. The Japanese defeat was largely a product of the American military. Though it was a coalition of Allied forces from multinational backgrounds that determined the country was to be occupied after the war, it was America that took the lead — and at the helm was General Douglas McArthur, the Supreme leader of the Allied Powers. MacArthur’s charisma and leadership style worked well with the Japanese mentality, and his enthusiasm for rebuilding was unparalleled. Building on the monumental changes brought during the Meiji restoration nearly a century before, MacArthur helped shepherd a new era. The occupation objective was more than ensuring that [Japan would not](https://www.jica.go.jp/Resource/dsp-chair/english/chair/modernization/ku57pq00002mpdct-att/modernization_chapter_03.pdf) “become a menace to the United States or to the peace and security of the world.” Using the lessons learned from WWI, the United States used the population’s disillusion with the government and desperate economic state to lay the base work of Democracy — though it elected not to force democracy, rather it aimed to support the Japanese in the creation of a new government of their choosing. [Documents outlining](https://www.history.com/news/post-wwii-us-japan-occupation-allies) the United States plan emphasized its desire for a government that conformed, “as closely as may be to the principles of democratic self-government,” but acknowledged that it was “not the responsibility of the Allied Powers to impose upon Japan any form of government not supported by the freely expressed will of the people.” Rather than humiliate Japan, the aim was to prop it up, ensure that the economy didn’t crash, and that the people didn’t grow resentful of the Allied Powers. Unlike post-war Germany, Japan was to govern itself, albeit with heavy guidance from General McArthur and the Allies. In MacArthur’s official staff reports, it stated that any involvement was to aid the Japanese by encouraging local officials and civilians to participate in the overhaul of the existing civil structure, and to prevent citizens from feeling, “the loss of self-respect and self-confidence.” A key step in this plan was to allow Emperor Hirohito to save face. With Hirohito on America’s side, President Truman asserted that the Japanese people would be more likely to cooperate with the occupation and make the transition from a nationalist imperial state to a democratic one more easily. Though Hirohito made for a valuable ally, the title of emperor was stripped of any authority and reduced to that of a figurehead. Instead, a cabinet of ministers would enact policies and head the Japanese government. To preserve morale, Hirohito never used the word “surrender” during his address to the Japanese people at the end of the war. Rather, he implied that Japan chose peace in the face of overwhelming violence from weapons like the atomic bomb. A narrative was spun accusing the military of betraying the emperor, who was cleared of all war crimes after he agreed to appoint a cabinet of advisors approved by Allied forces. The Japanese military was completely disarmed, a decision that was enshrined in the constitution’s [9th article](https://japan.kantei.go.jp/constitution_and_government_of_japan/constitution_e.html#:~:text=Article%209.,means%20of%20settling%20international%20disputes.) and is still hotly contested to this day. Military leaders were banned from the political sphere, and trials for their war crimes were held in Tokyo to punish the so-called sedition. Additionally, American forces took drastic measures to redistribute wealth in Japan. Wealthy businesses (Zaibatsu) and landowners were stripped of much of their wealth, which was redistributed from the business conglomerates that fueled the war efforts to agricultural sectors, giving land to farmers and pushing for labor reforms. Before the war, more than half of Japanese farmers were tenant farmers — they owned nothing, and produced for wealthy landowners. A new Ministry of Labor was created to pass laws on trade unions and labor relations, modeled after President Roosevelt’s New Deal. The right to vote was given to not only working-class men but also women; 38 women won the vote in the first election in 1946. Japan and the fight against the Red Menace By 1946, British Prime Minister Winston Churchill was sounding the alarm in Europe. The “Iron Curtain” had descended, sowing the seeds of the eventual Cold War. Japan’s position in the Pacific made it a key actor in halting the spread of communism. The US aimed to have Japan a functioning “self-sufficient democracy, strong enough and stable enough to support itself” but simultaneously strong enough to hold the “Far East,” but by 1948, the US had run out of time. The reunification of Korea failed, splitting the country in two. The North was a hotbed of communism, and the South a fledgling democracy. By 1949, the Communist Party defeated the Nationalist Party in China, cementing [ Mao Zedong’s](https://wegotthiscovered.com/politics/why-did-china-enter-the-korean-war/) rise to power. China and the Soviet Union formed a formidable alliance, and by 1950 North Korea attacked the South, launching the Korean War, kicking off the not-so-Cold War. It was more imperative than ever for Japan to be self-sufficient. In 1951, the United States hosted a peace conference to discuss The San Francisco Treaty. The treaty proclaimed Japan an independent nation and ended any claim it might have on Korea. Additionally, it required no reparations to be paid to any nation the country had attacked during WWII — including China, which was not invited to the peace talks. [The Soviet Union](https://wegotthiscovered.com/tag/soviet-union/) opposed the treaty, but the Prime Minister of Japan, Yoshida Shigeru, accepted the conditions and officially ended the American occupation — but only on paper. Japan still had no military might and in the face of the growing threat, Shigeru tapped the United States for a security treaty. America would provide substantial military support, meaning the occupation continued. The U.S. had one condition: That Japan work on bolstering its military might, but Article 9 caused contention. After much deliberation, Japan elected to create a “security force,” a paramilitary that was established in 1954, and never changed the phrasing of Article 9. That same year, Japan reached a treaty with the Soviet Union and officially entered the UN. Japan after the Cold War Despite fears of war, Japan experienced an economic boom between the late 50s and the early 70s. As mechanization made agricultural yields plentiful, rural residents transplanted to metropolitan areas. One out of 9 people lived in Tokyo and less than 20% of the population worked in the agricultural sector — a dramatic shift from the nearly 50% just 20 years before. Though the Vietnam War strained US-Japanese relationships through the 60s, the relationship stabilized by the early 70s. By the 80s, the Japanese economy [was one of the world’s](https://www.britannica.com/place/Japan/Political-developments) largest and most sophisticated. It emphasized international exports, inexplicably linking Japan to the delicacies and [ entertainment we all love](https://wegotthiscovered.com/anime/) today. [Learn more](https://wegotthiscovered.com/affiliate-policy/)

author: FAITH MTWANA
title: Eastern Cape pupils to show off their robotics skills in Panama
text:
Eastern Cape pupils to show off their robotics skills in Panama
A pair of tech-savvy Eastern Cape teens are hoping to crack the code to success on the international stage after being selected to represent SA’s “Spring Bots” team competing at the First Global Robotics Challenge in Panama.
Amy Brown, from Uitenhage High School, and Clyde Snyder, from Paterson High School, have been chosen as the only provincial representatives for team SA as they travel to Panama City in October to compete from October 29 to November 1.
The robotics challenge is an Olympics-style, international robotics competition where teams from 190 countries compete to build and program robots.
Clyde and Amy, both 14-year-old grade 9 pupils, were chosen to be part of the national team after excelling at the regional competition in May.
Amy said she joined the school’s robotics club on a whim and quickly discovered a passion for the field.
“My friends told me about the new robotics class and I was curious, so I joined it.
“I am so grateful to the teachers who have taught me so much about technology and robotics.
“I am excited for the trip to Panama City and to experience a new country.
“My goal is to win the competition so that I can make my school and my country proud. I also want to encourage other young minds that anything is possible,” Amy said.
Her teammate, Clyde, has been a part of his school’s robotics club since grade 8.
“I enjoy learning how the robots are programmed and how they work.
“I am proud to represent my school and my country. To prepare, I have been doing mini challenges and learning more about robotics.
“I hope we do well and show more people that robotics is fun,” Clyde said.
The pair will travel to Johannesburg for two training sessions before they leave for Panama City.
Gary Hendricks, the robotics teacher at Uitenhage High School, said pupils had shown great interest in the activity.
“Amy has shown great potential. She has earned this opportunity through her determination and willingness to learn.”
Paterson High School principal Rose de Doncker said they had been monitoring Clyde’s progress since grade 8.
“It is so amazing to see a child from our community achieve something so big.
“He has become a beacon of hope for us, and we are so proud.
“We can’t wait to see him fly high,” she said.
The Herald

author: sina_mobile
title: 微软能源副总裁看好风能和太阳能为数据中心供电潜力_手机新浪网
text:
微软能源副总裁看好风能和太阳能为数据中心供电潜力
微软;)能源副总裁鲍比·霍利斯（Bobby Hollis）周三在休斯顿举行的CERAWeek能源会议上对媒体表示，美国风能和太阳能开发在为数据中心供电方面仍有很大的拓展空间，特别是在中西部风能走廊和阳光充足的西南地区。
霍利斯指出，尽管美国在可再生能源领域取得了显著进展，但仍有大量未开发的潜力，尤其是在中西部和西南地区。这些地区拥有丰富的风能和太阳能资源，可以为数据中心提供可持续的电力支持。随着数据中心对能源需求的不断增长，风能和太阳能的进一步开发将有助于满足这一需求，同时推动清洁能源;)的使用。
霍利斯还提到，微软正在积极投资可再生能源项目，以实现其可持续发展目标，并减少碳足迹。他表示，未来几年，风能和太阳能的扩展将成为数据中心能源供应的重要组成部分。
责任编辑：张俊 SF065

author: Capricho
title: Estes 6 filmes vão sair da Netflix em maio de 2025
text:
Estes 6 filmes vão sair da Netflix em maio de 2025
Alguns títulos vão deixar o catálogo da plataforma e te contamos qual é o último dia para assistir cada um
Estamos entrando em maio e o catálogo da Netflix vai receber uma lista repleta de novidades muito aguardadas. Por outro lado, algumas produções também vão deixar a plataforma de streaming nos próximos dias.
+ Filmes e séries que estreiam na Netflix em maio de 2025
Para dar tempo de assistir mais uma vez, a CH preparou uma lista com 6 filmes que não vão mais estar disponíveis no streaming. Entre os destaques, teremos a saída de Blade Runner 2049, longa lançado em 2017 com um elenco formado por Ryan Gosling, Harrison Ford, Ana de Armas e mais personalidades de Hollywood.
A lista de produções que vão ficar indisponíveis no catálogo da plataforma também conta com projetos como Meu Pai, estrelado por Olivia Colman, e Relação Explosiva, que tem Dax Shepard, Kristen Bell e Bradley Cooper no elenco.
Confira 6 filmes que deixam o catálogo da Netflix em maio de 2025
1. Blade Runner 2049
Última data para assistir: 1 de maio de 2025
2. Estranhos em Casa
Última data para assistir: 1 de maio
3. O Grande Mentiroso
Última data para assistir: 1 de maio
4. Meu Pai
Última data para assistir: 1 de maio
5. Relação Explosiva
Última data para assistir: 1 de maio
6. Tudo por um Furo
Última data para assistir: 4 de maio
E aí, sabe por onde vai começar a maratona?
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->online media outlet

author: Godwin Isenyo
title: Gunmen in military uniform kill three, 100 cows in Kaduna
text: Residents in the Igabi Local Government Area of Kaduna State are in shock after men in military uniform stormed the Sabon Birnin Daji Cattle Market and opened fire, killing three persons and over 100 cows.

author: KRISTI NIEMEYER
title: SKC grads: "The world needs what you have" - NewsBreak
text:
Polson
SKC grads: "The world needs what you have"
By KRISTI NIEMEYER,
40 minutes agoThe Joe McDonald Health and Fitness Center was packed to capacity Saturday with Salish Kootenai College graduates seated in chairs on the gym floor and well-wishers crowding the bleachers. Eldena Bear Don’t Walk, chair of the SKC Board of Directors, reminded students, “you carry with you not only a degree but the hopes and pride of an entire community.” Interim president Stacey Sherwin spoke about the value of resilience – “let’s face it, you all have degrees in bouncing back … it’s not about being perfect, it’s about persistence.” Faced with the setbacks that life inevitably delivers, she coached them to “laugh a little, learn a lot and lean on your friends and family when you need to.” With that skill set, she predicted, “you will be unstoppable.” “The world needs what you have,” she added. “Your ideas, your kindness, your courage and your resilience.” “Give yourself permission to root for yourself, to be proud of yourself,” advised commencement speaker JoRee LaFrance. “… We deserve to thrive in our own communities.” James Douthwaite, who earned his bachelor’s in Forest Management, was named Student of the Year. During his tenure at SKC, he has maintained a 4.0 GPA, and will pursue

author: financialcontent.com
title: Residential Heating & Cooling Offers HVAC Upkeep and Safety Tips for Extreme Weather | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
It helps people protect their HVAC systems in drastic weather conditions. Schaumberg, IL - January 15, 2024 - Residential Heating & Cooling , a trusted HVAC company in Schaumburg, IL, and surrounding areas, offers useful tips for HVAC upkeep and safety during extreme weather events for the benefit of homeowners.
HVAC systems are considered long-term investments that need to be well looked after because the comfort of one’s home depends on them. However, due to wear and tear, damages, or in cases of extreme weather events, their functioning can be seriously compromised. For the people of Schaumburg, IL, and surrounding areas, Residential Heating & Cooling is the name they can trust for all types of HVAC services that ensure not only their longevity but also their optimal functioning.
The company came into being in 2009 with the mission of providing quality HVAC maintenance , installation, and repairs for the people of the region. Over the years, its commitment has earned it sterling 5-star reviews and an impeccable BBB record. At the heart of the services offered by the company is its customer-centric approach and attention to detail. It has a team of friendly customer support professionals who are readily available to address clients’ inquiries, take their needs into account, and offer them solutions accordingly.
The award-winning company is also known for its certified and well-trained technicians who can efficiently handle all kinds of HVAC services. They are friendly and provide 24-hour service to help clients in emergencies. The company is equipped with state-of-the-art equipment and tools to guarantee top-notch service. From heating and cooling services to various comfort solutions, it is a one-stop shop for clients’ varied needs.
Beyond its technical expertise, Residential Heating & Cooling provides crucial information on a regular basis to help clients protect their HVAC systems. It gives tips for upkeep and safety during extreme weather to know what to do during these situations and protect one’s precious HVAC systems. It stresses the importance of surge protector installation in such circumstances.
Additionally, the article talks about steps to take, including shutting down the AC system and shielding outdoor equipment with protection barriers, fencing, etc. In times like these, backup generators can be lifesavers for people. The article also recommends a regular check by a professional as it can identify issues early, which could get worse in extreme weather conditions.
To learn more about these tips in detail and the services provided by the company, one can visit https://residentialheatingcooling.com/ .
About Residential Heating & Cooling
Established in 2009, the company has gone from strength to strength by raising the bar for heating and air conditioning services to become the trusted name amongst the people of Schaumburg, IL, and surrounding areas.
